content: use their left needle to assist in making a space under the slipped stitch or to more closely replicate the feel of a full knit stitch use whatever method works for you to put a new loop one at a time through each slipped heel flap stitch when you re finished you ll have 22 stitches from the heel turn plus the 15 stitches from the heel flap work the 36 stitches that have been resting in the ribbing pattern starting with p1 k2 p2 and ending with p1 pick up and knit 15 stitches along the left side of the heel flap you should now be at the beginning of the heel turn section with 22 + 15 + 36 + 15 = 88 stitches on your needles from this point on you ll work in the round again decreasing on the sides for the gusset then working evenly for the length of the foot then decreasing and finishing at the toes to keep things clear arrange your stitches so they are divided between the 36 in ribbed pattern that are the top of the foot and the 52 that are in stockinette all knit stitch that are the bottom and sides of the foot the decreasing will all happen on the very edges of the stockinette sections for the gusset and the edges of the top and bottom sections for the toe you should be ready to knit across the rest of the heel up to the last 2 stitches when you get to the last 2 stockinette stitches before switching to the ribbed section for the top of the foot knit those two stitches together place a stitch marker here if it helps you remember that this is where your round starts different designers choose different starting points depending on what they need to communicate or just note that for the sake of these instructions a round starts at the beginning of the ribbed section with the p1 stitch being the first stitch of the round knit across the ribbed top section in pattern p1 k2 p2 k2… p1 at the beginning of the stockinette section ssk then knit to the end of the stockinette section/end of the round notice that you ve decreased one stitch on each side of this section and that the decreases are leaning in opposite directions this is going to create a nice line in your gusset © 2025 kiersten harrod all rights reserved go to www kierstenj com for more resources to help you be a better knitter page 5 of 7 you re going to continue this pattern of making a decrease on alternating sides of the stockinette section each time you go around until you have 36 stitches left on the stockinette section the same number of stitches as you have in the top ribbed section notice please that you do not work decreases on both sides of the stockinette section
